body: @nigeltao Yes, of course I could. And there are probably other ways, as well.  The thing is, the code I posted was the first thing that came to my mind (instinctively). And immediately I though: "I guess `append()` will be clever enough to avoid the copy and just do a re-slice (extend)". I checked, and it turns out it isn't. Which was a bit surprising. *Especially* considering that the cost of detecting the (uncommon) special case turns out to be negligible. I think (and this is a judgement call) that doing "the right thing" in this case justifies the (almost negligible) cost.
